questions.question: If she left office at six, she ……………….. be here soon.
questions.description: We use should to indicate logical possibility.

questions.question: …………………………. I write to him?
questions.description: We use should to ask for a suggestion.

questions.question: She ……………………………. be informed.
questions.description: We use should to express necessity.

questions.question: You ………………………….. always speak the truth.
questions.description: We use should to express necessity.

questions.question: You …………………………… talk back to your parents.
I …………………………. bake a cake if I got time.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I ………………………………. be grateful if you could help me.
questions.description: Both would and should can be used with the first person pronouns with little difference of meaning.

questions.question: ……………………………. you like some coffee?
questions.description: Would is used to make an offer sound more polite.

questions.question: You ………………………… consult a financial advisor before investing your money.
questions.description: Should is used to tell people what they should do.

questions.question: I knew that I ………………………… quit smoking.
You …………………………… have wished her on her birthday.
